metadata.title: CVE-2014-6430 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The SnifferDecompress function in wiretap/ngsniffer.c in the DOS Snifferfile parser in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.10 and 1.12.x before 1.12.1does not validate bitmask data, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (application crash) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
